snippet: Talks begin this week on a new Canadian Auto Workers contract as the three Detroit automakers have been scaling back their operations in Canada.
abstract: Talks begin on a new Canadian Auto Workers contract as the three Detroit automakers have been scaling back their operations in Canada; dollar's high value, which most economists anticipate will continue, has more than obliterated the traditional cost advantage Canadian auto plants once enjoyed.
lead_paragraph: Talks begin this week on a new Canadian Auto Workers contract as the three Detroit automakers have been scaling back their operations in Canada.

headline.seo: Canadian Dollar’s Strength a Factor in Autoworkers Talks
headline.main: Canadian Dollar’s Strength a Factor in Autoworkers’ Talks
headline.print_headline: Canadian Dollar’s Strength a Factor in Autoworkers’ Contract Talks
